New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers matched the second-best start to a season in NBA history with a 15-0 record.
The win streak is already the longest in the Cavaliers' 55-year history, eclipsing three 13-win runs when LeBron James was with Cleveland.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland had 25 points and 12 assists for the Cavaliers.
Ty Jerome added 24 points for the Cavaliers.
Evan Mobley scored 23 points and grabbed 11 rebounds for the Cavaliers.
Jarrett Allen contributed 21 points and 15 rebounds for the Cavaliers.
LaMelo Ball had 31 points and 12 assists in a losing cause for the Hornets.
Pre-Game Insights: Donovan Mitchell took the night off to rest after averaging 24.6 points, 4.4 rebounds and 4.1 assists for the Cavs during their perfect run.
Post-Match Reflections: Darius Garland said, "Everybody is ready to play. It doesn't matter, one through 15. Everybody contributed. Everybody had a huge part in this win. That's just us. Just as a team effort."
